fr:mainmatter.fr:p: A pretopos is an effective and positive coherent category.

fr:title.text: Every monomorphism is regular in a pretopos

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Every monomorphism is regular in a pretopos

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: In a pretopos, every monomorphism is regular.
Let f\colon A\rightarrowtail B be a monomorphism in a pretopos. By , there is a pullback square

fr:embedded-tex.fr:embedded-tex-body: \DiagramSquare { nw = A, nw/style = {pullback}, ne = B, sw = B, se = C, north = f, north/style = {>->}, west = f, west/style = {>->}, south = h, south/style = {>->}, east = k, east/style = {>->}, }

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: But, this pullback square is an equalizer of h and k.

fr:title.text: Pushouts of monomorphisms in a pretopos

fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Pushouts of monomorphisms in a pretopos

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let f\colon A\rightarrowtail B and g\colon A\rightarrowtail C be a pair of monomorphisms in a pretopos. Then they have a pushout.

fr:embedded-tex.fr:embedded-tex-body: \DiagramSquare { nw = A, ne = C, sw = B, se = D, se/style = {pushout}, north = g, north/style = {>->}, west = f, west/style = {>->}, south = k, east = h, }

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Moreover, h and k are monic and the square is also a pullback.

We construct D by quotienting the disjoint union B \uplus C by an appropriate equivalence relation. Note that disjoint unions are coproducts by . Let us write \iota _{1}\colon B\rightarrowtail B \uplus C and \iota _{2}\colon C\rightarrowtail B \uplus C for the coproduct injections. Consider the following definitions.
fr:mainmatter.fr:tex: \begin {align*} &D_{0} &&:= B \uplus C\\ &R &&:= B \uplus A \uplus A \uplus C\\ &a &&:= [\iota _{1},\iota _{1}f,\iota _{2}g,\iota _{2}]\colon R\to D_{0}\\ &b &&:= [\iota _{1},\iota _{2}g,\iota _{1}f,\iota _{2}]\colon R\to D_{0} \end {align*}

fr:mainmatter.fr:p: A coherent category is said to be positive if it has disjoint finite coproducts.

An equivalence relation in a cartesian category is said to be effective if it is the kernel pair of some morphism. An effective category is a cartesian category in which every equivalence relation is effective.
